channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Supervised Acoustic Embeddings And Their Transferability Across Languages
item.description: In speech recognition, it is essential to model the phonetic content of the input signal while discarding irrelevant factors such as speaker variations and noise, which is challenging in low-resource settings.

item.title: RELIANT: Fair Knowledge Distillation for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Knowledge Distillation (KD) is a common solution to compress GNNs, where a light-weighted model (i. e., the student model) is encouraged to mimic the behavior of a computationally expensive GNN (i. e., the teacher GNN model).

item.title: Vocabulary-informed Zero-shot and Open-set Learning
item.description: Despite significant progress in object categorization, in recent years, a number of important challenges remain; mainly, the ability to learn from limited labeled data and to recognize object classes within large, potentially open, set of labels.

item.title: Exploring Complex Dynamical Systems via Nonconvex Optimization
item.description: Cataloging the complex behaviors of dynamical systems can be challenging, even when they are well-described by a simple mechanistic model.

item.title: TinyMIM: An Empirical Study of Distilling MIM Pre-trained Models
item.description: Our TinyMIM model of tiny size achieves 79. 6% top-1 accuracy on ImageNet-1K image classification, which sets a new record for small vision models of the same size and computation budget.

item.title: Correlation Loss: Enforcing Correlation between Classification and Localization
item.description: (ii) Motivated by our observations, e. g., that NMS-free detectors can also benefit from correlation, we propose Correlation Loss, a novel plug-in loss function that improves the performance of various object detectors by directly optimizing correlation coefficients: E. g., Correlation Loss on Sparse R-CNN, an NMS-free method, yields 1. 6 AP gain on COCO and 1. 8 AP gain on Cityscapes dataset.

item.title: Computing the Performance of A New Adaptive Sampling Algorithm Based on The Gittins Index in Experiments with Exponential Rewards
item.description: Designing experiments often requires balancing between learning about the true treatment effects and earning from allocating more samples to the superior treatment.

item.title: Average Is Not Enough: Caveats of Multilingual Evaluation
item.description: This position paper discusses the problem of multilingual evaluation.

item.title: Large Language Models as Corporate Lobbyists
item.description: For the bills the model deems as relevant, the model drafts a letter to the sponsor of the bill in an attempt to persuade the congressperson to make changes to the proposed legislation.

item.title: Cross Modal Transformer via Coordinates Encoding for 3D Object Dectection
item.description: In this paper, we propose a robust 3D detector, named Cross Modal Transformer (CMT), for end-to-end 3D multi-modal detection.

item.title: xDeepInt: a hybrid architecture for modeling the vector-wise and bit-wise feature interactions
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new model, xDeepInt, based on a novel network architecture called polynomial interaction network (PIN) which learns higher-order vector-wise interactions recursively.

item.title: MGTAB: A Multi-Relational Graph-Based Twitter Account Detection Benchmark
item.description: However, in addition to low annotation quality, existing benchmarks generally have incomplete user relationships, suppressing graph-based account detection research.

item.title: Understanding Imbalanced Semantic Segmentation Through Neural Collapse
item.description: Based on our empirical and theoretical analysis, we point out that semantic segmentation naturally brings contextual correlation and imbalanced distribution among classes, which breaks the equiangular and maximally separated structure of neural collapse for both feature centers and classifiers.

item.title: Backdoor Attacks Against Dataset Distillation
item.description: A model trained on this smaller distilled dataset can attain comparable performance to a model trained on the original training dataset.

item.title: Cluster-guided Contrastive Graph Clustering Network
item.description: Then, guided by the high-confidence clustering information, we carefully select and construct the positive samples from the same high-confidence cluster in two views.

item.title: OccluMix: Towards De-Occlusion Virtual Try-on by Semantically-Guided Mixup
item.description: Image Virtual try-on aims at replacing the cloth on a personal image with a garment image (in-shop clothes), which has attracted increasing attention from the multimedia and computer vision communities.

item.title: PanopticPartFormer++: A Unified and Decoupled View for Panoptic Part Segmentation
item.description: Thirdly, inspired by Mask2Former, based on our meta-architecture, we propose Panoptic-PartFormer++ and design a new part-whole cross attention scheme to further boost part segmentation qualities.

item.title: PMT-IQA: Progressive Multi-task Learning for Blind Image Quality Assessment
item.description: To verify the effectiveness of the proposed PMT-IQA model, we conduct experiments on four widely used public datasets, and the experimental results indicate that the performance of PMT-IQA is superior to the comparison approaches, and both MS and PMT modules improve the model's performance.

item.title: Diffusion Probabilistic Models for Scene-Scale 3D Categorical Data
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, our work is the first to apply discrete and latent diffusion for 3D categorical data on a scene-scale.

item.title: Lightweight Image Inpainting by Stripe Window Transformer with Joint Attention to CNN
item.description: Image inpainting is an important task in computer vision.

item.title: ConvNeXt V2: Co-designing and Scaling ConvNets with Masked Autoencoders
item.description: This co-design of self-supervised learning techniques and architectural improvement results in a new model family called ConvNeXt V2, which significantly improves the performance of pure ConvNets on various recognition benchmarks, including ImageNet classification, COCO detection, and ADE20K segmentation.

item.title: Analysing Discrete Self Supervised Speech Representation for Spoken Language Modeling
item.description: Following the findings of such an analysis, we propose practical improvements to the discrete unit for the GSLM.

item.title: P3DC-Shot: Prior-Driven Discrete Data Calibration for Nearest-Neighbor Few-Shot Classification
item.description: Inspired by the distribution calibration technique which utilizes the distribution or statistics of the base classes to calibrate the data for few-shot tasks, we propose a novel discrete data calibration operation which is more suitable for NN-based few-shot classification.

item.title: Task-specific Scene Structure Representations
item.description: Understanding the informative structures of scenes is essential for low-level vision tasks.

item.title: Learning Invariance from Generated Variance for Unsupervised Person Re-identification
item.description: This work focuses on unsupervised representation learning in person re-identification (ReID).

item.title: Argoverse 2: Next Generation Datasets for Self-Driving Perception and Forecasting
item.description: Models are tasked with the prediction of future motion for "scored actors" in each scenario and are provided with track histories that capture object location, heading, velocity, and category.

item.title: Credible Remote Sensing Scene Classification Using Evidential Fusion on Aerial-Ground Dual-view Images
item.description: Based on this uncertainty, a novel decision-level fusion strategy is proposed to ensure that the view with lower risk obtains more weight, making the classification more credible.

item.title: CLIP-Driven Universal Model for Organ Segmentation and Tumor Detection
item.description: The model is developed from an assembly of 14 datasets with 3, 410 CT scans and evaluated on 6, 162 external CT scans from 3 datasets.

item.title: Fusing Models for Prognostics and Health Management of Lithium-Ion Batteries Based on Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: Physics-Informed Neural Network (PINN) is an efficient tool to fuse empirical or physical dynamic models with data-driven models.

item.title: The Undesirable Dependence on Frequency of Gender Bias Metrics Based on Word Embeddings
item.description: In this work we study the effect of frequency when measuring female vs. male gender bias with word embedding-based bias quantification methods.

item.title: Follow the Timeline! Generating Abstractive and Extractive Timeline Summary in Chronological Order
item.description: Nowadays, time-stamped web documents related to a general news query floods spread throughout the Internet, and timeline summarization targets concisely summarizing the evolution trajectory of events along the timeline.

item.title: MAUD: An Expert-Annotated Legal NLP Dataset for Merger Agreement Understanding
item.description: Reading comprehension of legal text can be a particularly challenging task due to the length and complexity of legal clauses and a shortage of expert-annotated datasets.

item.title: OF-AE: Oblique Forest AutoEncoders
item.description: In the present work we propose an unsupervised ensemble method consisting of oblique trees that can address the task of auto-encoding, namely Oblique Forest AutoEncoders (briefly OF-AE).

item.title: PCRLv2: A Unified Visual Information Preservation Framework for Self-supervised Pre-training in Medical Image Analysis
item.description: Recent advances in self-supervised learning (SSL) in computer vision are primarily comparative, whose goal is to preserve invariant and discriminative semantics in latent representations by comparing siamese image views.

item.title: Deep reinforcement learning for irrigation scheduling using high-dimensional sensor feedback
item.description: The results were compared against the benchmark profits obtained using irrigation schedules optimised individually for each of the considered years.

item.title: IRT2: Inductive Linking and Ranking in Knowledge Graphs of Varying Scale
item.description: Our focus is on inductive link prediction models as a basis for practical tools that support knowledge engineers with exploring text collections and discovering and linking new (so-called open-world) entities to the knowledge graph.

item.title: Deep Learning Technique for Human Parsing: A Survey and Outlook
item.description: Human parsing aims to partition humans in image or video into multiple pixel-level semantic parts.

item.title: Detachable Novel Views Synthesis of Dynamic Scenes Using Distribution-Driven Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: Specifically, it employs a neural representation to capture the scene distribution in the static background and a 6D-input NeRF to represent dynamic objects, respectively.

item.title: Curvature regularization for Non-line-of-sight Imaging from Under-sampled Data
item.description: Non-line-of-sight (NLOS) imaging aims to reconstruct the three-dimensional hidden scenes from the data measured in the line-of-sight, which uses photon time-of-flight information encoded in light after multiple diffuse reflections.

item.title: MIGPerf: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Deep Learning Training and Inference Workloads on Multi-Instance GPUs
item.description: The vision of this paper is to provide a more comprehensive and practical benchmark study for MIG in order to eliminate the need for tedious manual benchmarking and tuning efforts.

item.title: An Adaptive Kernel Approach to Federated Learning of Heterogeneous Causal Effects
item.description: We propose a new causal inference framework to learn causal effects from multiple, decentralized data sources in a federated setting.

item.title: Optimizing Readability Using Genetic Algorithms
item.description: An exhaustive study on a substantial number and diversity of texts confirms that our method was able to optimize the degree of readability in all cases without significantly altering their form or meaning.

item.title: EvidenceCap: Towards trustworthy medical image segmentation via evidential identity cap
item.description: Medical image segmentation (MIS) is essential for supporting disease diagnosis and treatment effect assessment.

item.title: Generalizable Black-Box Adversarial Attack with Meta Learning
item.description: In the scenario of black-box adversarial attack, the target model's parameters are unknown, and the attacker aims to find a successful adversarial perturbation based on query feedback under a query budget.

item.title: MTNeuro: A Benchmark for Evaluating Representations of Brain Structure Across Multiple Levels of Abstraction
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce a new dataset, annotations, and multiple downstream tasks that provide diverse ways to readout information about brain structure and architecture from the same image.

item.title: Correlation Clustering Algorithm for Dynamic Complete Signed Graphs: An Index-based Approach
item.description: In this paper, we reduce the complexity of approximating the correlation clustering problem from $O(m\times\left( 2+ \alpha (G) \right)+n)$ to $O(m+n)$ for any given value of $\varepsilon$ for a complete signed graph with $n$ vertices and $m$ positive edges where $\alpha(G)$ is the arboricity of the graph.

item.title: Skew Class-balanced Re-weighting for Unbiased Scene Graph Generation
item.description: An unbiased scene graph generation (SGG) algorithm referred to as Skew Class-balanced Re-weighting (SCR) is proposed for considering the unbiased predicate prediction caused by the long-tailed distribution.

item.title: Generative Graph Neural Networks for Link Prediction
item.description: Instead of sampling positive and negative links and heuristically computing the features of their enclosing subgraphs, GraphLP utilizes the feature learning ability of deep-learning models to automatically extract the structural patterns of graphs for link prediction under the assumption that real-world graphs are not locally isolated.

item.title: Towards Proactively Forecasting Sentence-Specific Information Popularity within Online News Documents
item.description: We model sentence-specific popularity forecasting as a sequence regression task.

item.title: Disjoint Masking with Joint Distillation for Efficient Masked Image Modeling
item.description: Masked image modeling (MIM) has shown great promise for self-supervised learning (SSL) yet been criticized for learning inefficiency.
